title: 88/367/EEC: Seventh Commission Decision of 18 May 1988 relating to the application of Council Directive 72/166/EEC on the approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to insurance against civil liability in respect of the use of motor vehicles, and to the enforcement of the obligation to insure against such liability
header:
SEVENTH  COMMISSION DECISION
of 18 May 1988
relating to the application of Council Directive 72/166/EEC on the approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to insurance against civil liability in respect of the use of motor vehicles, and to the enforcement of the obligation to insure against such liability
(88/367/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: As from 1 July 1988 Greece shall refrain from making checks on insurance against civil liability in respect of vehicles normally based in the other Member States and the other Member States shall refrain from making such checks in respect of vehicles normally based in Greece.
Member States shall forthwith inform the Commission of measures taken to apply this Decision.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 18 May 1988.
For the Commission
COCKFIELD
Vice-President
